issue.title: Constant crash in any app
issue.body:
### Summary

Constant crash when using Pinyin since last week Debian upgrade.
journalctl -xb:
```

░░ Defined-By: systemd
░░ Support: https://www.debian.org/support
░░ 
░░ The unit UNIT completed and consumed the indicated resources.
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Switch to Pinyin
2. Type quickly in Firefox
3. fcitx5 crash, only left word picker

### Expected Behavior

Don't crash

### Output of fcitx5-diagnose command

body: Bisect shows that the issue starts with d9fc64d3ab289a84548e952183d7eba79ccc846e

I think I almost get what's happening.

https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/d9fc64d3ab289a84548e952183d7eba79ccc846e merged a pointer into upper struct to avoid extra memory allocation. Before the change, the null means a special empty state.  After the change, this was replaced as a bool flag thread_data::init.

However, the in many cases, even by just reading the change in the commit, I found in multiple location that simply remove the null check but didn't replace it with a check on ->init. This makes Curl_resolver_getsock still returns 0 after destroy_thread_sync_data().

issue.title: asyn-thread: check thread_data::init in Curl_resolver_getsock

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
resolver may call destroy_async_data after the name is resolved and corresponding socketpair is already closed at this point. Any following call to Curl_resolver_getsock should not set the fd.

Fix #16799

issue.title: Fcitx crashes

repository.name: fcitx5-chinese-addons
repository.description: Addons related to Chinese, including IME previous bundled inside fcitx4.

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
The first one or two inputs with >5 chars (usually in chrome) after system restart will crash. After that everything works well.

~/.config/fcitx5/crash.log suggests libcloudpinyin is the culprit. fcitx-diagnose:
